AccountLink - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.account
A AccountLink represents the link between 2 Accounts

Deleting this resource will only delete the association - it will not delete the accounts themselves Account

addAccount(Account) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.group.Group
Assigns the specified Account to this Group.
addAccount(String) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.group.Group
Assigns this Group to the specified Account represented by its (case insensitive) username, email or href

Immediate Execution: Unlike other Group methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards.

addAccountStore(AccountStore) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.application.Application
Creates a new ApplicationAccountStoreMapping for this Application and appends that ApplicationAccountStoreMapping to the end of the Application's ApplicationAccountStoreMapping list, allowing the associated accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the Application.

Convenience method to add a a new AccountStore to this application.

addAccountStore(AccountStore) - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.organization.Organization
Creates a new OrganizationAccountStoreMapping for this Organization and appends that OrganizationAccountStoreMapping to the end of the Organization's OrganizationAccountStoreMapping list, allowing the association accountStore to be used as a source of accounts that may login to the Organization.

ApiAuthenticationResult - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.api
An AuthenticationResult that indicates a client authenticated with your server-side API (eg REST API) using an ApiKey.
ApiKey - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.api
An ApiKey is a secure random username/password pair (called an id and secret) attributed to an Account that can be used by the account to make secure requests to an API service.
ApiKeyBuilder - Interface in com.stormpath.sdk.api
A Builder design pattern used to construct ApiKey instances.

newIdSiteUrlBuilder() - Method in interface com.stormpath.sdk.application.Application

WildcardPermission - Class in com.stormpath.spring.security.authz.permission
A WildcardPermission is a very flexible permission construct supporting multiple levels of permission matching.
WildcardPermission() - Constructor for class com.stormpath.spring.security.authz.permission.WildcardPermission
Default no-arg constructor for subclasses only - end-user developers instantiating instances must provide a wildcard string at a minimum, since these instances are immutable once instantiated.
